original_solution_mapping.L1: He gives a third of 12 oranges to his brother which is 12*(1/3) = <<12*(1/3)=4>>4 oranges
original_solution_mapping.L3: He gives a fourth of 8 oranges to his friend which is 8*(1/4) = <<8*(1/4)=2>>2 oranges

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4041.
    Returns: the number of oranges the friend gets.
    """
    # L1
    total_oranges = 12 # A boy has 12 oranges
    brother_fraction_numerator = 1 # one-third of this number
    brother_fraction_denominator = 3 # one-third of this number
    oranges_given_to_brother = total_oranges * Fraction(brother_fraction_numerator, brother_fraction_denominator)

    # L2
    oranges_remaining_after_brother = total_oranges - oranges_given_to_brother

    # L3
    friend_fraction_numerator = 1 # one-fourth of the remainder
    friend_fraction_denominator = 4 # one-fourth of the remainder
    oranges_given_to_friend = oranges_remaining_after_brother * Fraction(friend_fraction_numerator, friend_fraction_denominator)

    # FA
    answer = oranges_given_to_friend
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He gives a third of {total_oranges} oranges to his brother which is {total_oranges}*({brother_fraction_numerator}/{brother_fraction_denominator}) = <<{total_oranges}*({brother_fraction_numerator}/{brother_fraction_denominator})={oranges_given_to_brother}>>{oranges_given_to_brother} oranges

He gives a fourth of {oranges_remaining_after_brother} oranges to his friend which is {oranges_remaining_after_brother}*({friend_fraction_numerator}/{friend_fraction_denominator}) = <<{oranges_remaining_after_brother}*({friend_fraction_numerator}/{friend_fraction_denominator})={oranges_given_to_friend}>>{oranges_given_to_friend} oranges

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He gives a third of 12 oranges to his brother which is 12*(1/3) = <<12*(1/3)=4>>4 oranges
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He gives a fourth of 3 oranges to his friend which is 3*(1/4) = <<3*(1/4)=3/4>>3/4 oranges

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '/' instead.
